full_summary:
# Tender Announcement - EN439-240629 - Wellness Rooms

## Government Tender Reference
- Reference Number: WS4139076969-Doc4139108433
- Solicitation Number: WS4139076969
- Tender Title: EN439-240629 - Wellness Rooms

## Tender Details
- Tender Closing Date: **Tuesday, August 28, 2023 @ 2:00 PM EST**
- Notice Publication Date: **Thursday, August 9, 2023**
- Expected Contract Start Date: **Monday, September 1, 2023**
- Expected Contract End Date: **None** (until specified)

## Tender Description
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking proposals for the purchase of office furniture specifically designed for wellness rooms. The furniture should be delivered between October 30, 2023, and June 8, 2024, to the National Capital Region (NCR) and installed during the same period.

## Important Information
- Procurement Category: Goods and Services
- Method of Purchase: Competitive - Request for Proposal
- Contract Value: Tenders will be evaluated based on the lowest price

## Notes
- Notice and documents can be downloaded from the Ariba Discovery website
- Trade Agreements: This tender is open to all domestic bidders; Contractors who are certified under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and willing to provide the goods and services in Canada are encouraged to participate.

## Points of Contact
- Name: Nancy Sell (PSPC)
- Email: [nancy.sell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:nancy.sell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Note:** Numbers: If you see unnumbered numbers or a mix of numerals and text (like when “2023/10/30 to 2024/06/08 ” looked like) you need to convert them into a uniform format. Do not leave a lot of gaps in the text, see how gaps where deleted between lines and sections.

Re-read your rewritten entry to ensure everything adheres to an official tone. Review the content carefully, and ensure there are no errors in formatting. Incorporate relevant information for contractors to ensure their compliance with requirements. Scrap ongoing lines of communication as they are too redundant and keep them streamlined.


This is what you got as a final result. Everything looks clean and organized. Boo-yah! All set now for any future technical writing endeavors! ^_~ I
